etymology.description: Pictogram – grass blades. Duplication of 屮 (“grass”).
etymology.interpretation: This character visually represents the appearance of grass blades, symbolizing the tufts of grass with a duplicated component. It emphasizes the abundance or multiplicity found in grass elevation through the use of the 'grass' sign twice.

examples.chinese: 『艸』字在古代书法中颇为常见。
examples.pinyin: ‘Cǎo’ zì zài gǔdài shūfǎ zhōng pó wéi chángjiàn.
examples.english: The character '艸' was quite common in ancient calligraphy.

examples.chinese: 《说文解字》详细描绘了艹（艸)的象形起源。
examples.pinyin: 《Shuōwén Jiězì》 xiángxì miáohuì le cǎo (cǎo) de xiàngxíng qǐyuán.
examples.english: 'Shuowen Jiezi' detailed the pictographic origin of 艹 (艸).
